txt.en: 'Here we are. If you don't mind, [placeholder], I would like a moment to myself.'
'How fair and fresh the Dale! I am glad I lived to see it.'
Instance: Greet the Sky
'Beautiful, is it not? It is true that the stars of the Mirrormere shimmer always upon the surface of the water, be it day or night. Look for yourself!'
'Welcome to Mekhem-bizru! I am pleased to see that you made it out of Moria with your skin still intact. You must be a bold warrior.\n\n'You may rest here, and look out upon fair Kheled-zâram.'
The dwarf invites you to look out upon Kheled-zâram
'I feel refreshed, and ready to return to the depths of Khazad-dûm to continue helping the expedition establish a foothold.\n\n'What do you plan to do?'
The waters of Kheled-zâram look cool and clear, the stars shining fair upon the surface like glimmering jewels.
This is a good vantage point
Svanr is in the First Hall of Nud-melek.
This is not a good vantage point
Svanr can be found outside of Moria, in the Dimrill Dale.\n\nYou should speak with Svanr.
Mekhem-bizru can be found down the path from the East Gate of Moria.
Kheled-zâram is the great lake that lies on the Dimrill Dale.\n\nYou should speak to a dwarf looking out upon Kheled-zâram.

The Mirrormere, also called Kheled-zâram, is the lake that lies against Mekhem-bizru in the Dimrill Dale.

You should <rgb=#FF0000>look</rgb> out upon the Mirrormere from Mekhem-bizru.

<rgb=#FF0000>NOTE: This quest requires emotes.</rgb>
Svanr is in the Dimrill Dale.\n\nYou should speak with Svanr.
Talk to Svanr
Follow Svanr to the Dimrill Dale
Talk to someone at Mekhem-bizru
Talk to a dwarf at the Mirrormere's edge
<rgb=#FF0000>Look</rgb> out at the Mirrormere from Mekhem-bizru
Return to Svanr
It is time to leave Moria at last, and soak up the fresh air again.

'I cannot wait to see the sun, moon, clouds, and stars once more! This trek has been a long one, and sad. We have suffered many losses.\n\n'I cannot be more thankful to lay eyes upon the fair sun once more, [placeholder].'
